Param.Name: LastRowNumber
Param.Description: The index of the last row we pushed

Param.Name: DataIndex
Param.Description: The index of the data we want to push

Information.Text: Whether we are busy generating data
Information.Subtext: Whether we are currently busy generating data.
Yes if we started generating data, otherwise No
IP address of the System Control Unit
Alarms when the SCU is not able to communicate with Exciter A
Alarms when the SCU is not able to communicate with Exciter B
Alarms if the 1st power supply is not working
Alarms if the 2nd power supply is not working
Alarms if the external RF Lock DCI is open

Information.Text: Combiner Power Supply or Fan Status

Information.Subtext: Alarms if the combiner temperature sensor trips
Alarms if there are internal communication problems with rear panel attached modules
Indicates whether SCU is in Remote or Local service mode
Indicates whether the user controlled RF output setting of the transmitter is on or not
Indicates which is the currently active exciter or indicates an error if there is not communication with the RF Selector module or the retrieved path is wrong
Configured switching type and/or selected exciter when manual switching type is selected

Param.Name: scuSystemSettingssystemrfuser
Param.Message:
WARNING
Do you want to switch the current RF output state of the transmitter?

Param.Name: exciterSelection
Param.Message:
WARNING
Do you want to change the exciter selection mode of the SCU?

Information.Subtext: Indicates the current RF output status of the transmitter amplifier. It alarms when the output power is lower than the configured thresholds etc.
Indicates the current SWR status of the transmitter amplifier. It alarms when the SWR value is lower than the configured threshold.

Information.Text: Power Amplifiers To Maximum Power (Emergency Mode)
Information.Subtext: Indicates when all active power amplifier units are boosted to their maximum power
Transmitter amplifier output power in watts
Transmitter amplifier output power in dB relative to the calibrated transmitter output power
Transmitter amplifier reflected power in dB
The calibrated transmitter reference output power in watts
The configured alarm threshold in dB for the transmitter output power relative to the reference power
The configured warning threshold in dB for the transmitter output power relative to the reference power
The configured SWR alarm threshold in dB for the transmitter

Param.Name: txReferenceOutputPowerWatts
Param.Message: WARNING Do you want to change or set the reference power output for this transmitter?

Information.Subtext: Total number of power amplifier units configured in the transmitter
The model type of power amplifier units configured in the transmitter

Param.Name: paType
Param.Message: Do you want to change the PA type? (This will alter the number of power supplies and fans that are monitored)

Information.Subtext: The alarm status of the power amplifier units configured in the transmitter
The power amplifier unit number
Indicates whether or not there is communication between the exciter or SCU and this power amplifier unit
Alarms when power amplifier unit input is below the threshold level
Warning or alarm when power amplifier unit output value is lower than user defined range

Information.Text: Power Amplifier Unit Reflected Power Status
Information.Subtext: Alarms when power amplifier unit reflected power is below the defined threshold
Indicates when the power amplifier unit temperature is too high

Information.Text: Power Amplifier Unit Fan System Status
Information.Subtext: Indicates when a problem is detected in the power amplifier unit cooling system

Information.Text: Power Amplifier Unit DC Supply Status
Information.Subtext: Indicates when a problem is detected in the power amplifier unit DC power supply

Information.Text: Power Amplifier Unit AC Supply Status
Information.Subtext: Indicates when a problem is detected in the power amplifier unit AC power supply
Indicates when a failure is detected in the power amplifier unit gain
The RF and temperature measurements of the power amplifier units configured in the transmitter
The power amplifier unit number
Power amplifier unit input power in dBm
Power amplifier unit output power in Watts
Power amplifier unit return loss in dB
Temperature measured in zone 1 of the power amplifier unit
Temperature measured in zone 2 of the power amplifier unit
The power supply measurements, fan speeds and version information of the power amplifier units configured in the transmitter
The power amplifier unit number
The amplifier voltage for the power supply in location 1 of the power amplifier unit (if fitted)
The amplifier current for the power supply in location 1 of the power amplifier unit (if fitted)
The amplifier voltage for the power supply in location 2 of the power amplifier unit (if fitted)
The amplifier current for the power supply in location 2 of the power amplifier unit (if fitted)
Fans PWM setting for zone 1 of the power amplifier unit
RPM measured for this fan in the power amplifier unit
RPM measured for this fan in the power amplifier unit
RPM measured for this fan in the power amplifier unit
